content:
Products for UK and Ireland must follow all national testing and labelling requirements:

Consumer Protection, The Furniture and Furnishings (Fire) (Safety) Regulations 1988 No. 1324 amended by: 1989 No. 2358, 1993 No. 207 and 2010 No. 2205.

Irish Statutory Instruments:

• The regulations relate to upholstered furnishings, which may be used in a home or caravan.

• There is no distinction made for furnishings intended for use by children; all are treated the same.

• If the primary use is for garden furniture but could be used in the dwelling, the regulations still apply.

• The regulations do not apply to furniture without upholstery, they do not apply to quilts/duvets for beds, mattress protectors or sleeping bags and they do not apply to air filled products.

Useful links to FIRA documents:

FIRA Flammability Guide

FIRA Best Practice Guide

The rules vary depending on the type of product - See Table 1.

content:
Visible covers must be cigarette- and match-resistant in accordance with schedule 4 and 5 of the UK regulations.

Covers must be cigarette- and match-resistant in accordance with schedule 4 and 5 of Irish Statutory IS 419.

Non-visible parts of furniture covers must be tested against the modified cigarette- and match test.

Fillings must meet the flammability requirements of Schedule 1 or 2 of the UK regulations.

Fillings must meet the flammability requirements of clauses 2 or 3 of Irish Statutory IS 419.

Covers made from fabrics whose fiber content is ≥75% (singly or in combination) of the fibers listed in Table 2 and fail the match test may be used in combination with a Fire Resistant interliner in accordance with schedule 3 of the UK regulations and schedule 3 of Irish Statutory IS 419.

• These products must carry the triangular display label, instead of the regular display label (See 3.2).

content:
Type 1 products must carry a permanent label in accordance with chapter 6 and a display label in accordance with Table 3. The display label must comply with specifications in 3.2.1.

Appropriate for products which meets the filling requirements and is both cigarette and match resistant.

Appropriate for products with a limited range of cover fabrics. The cover fabric is not match resistant, but the

product has an interliner which passes the specified test. The product meets the filling requirements and is cigarette resistant.

Appropriate for products which meets the filling requirements and is cigarette resistant.

Display labels for type 1 products must comply with below specifications:

• Size: 90x90 mm with rounded corners

• Colors: White, black, green, red.

• Have a front and backside according to template.

• The tag must not compromise or destroy the product when removed.
source: JYSK 4002 - UK and Ireland Fire Regulation.pdf

content:
Fillings must meet the flammability requirements of Schedule 1 or 2 of the UK regulations, according to Table 4. Fillings must meet the flammability requirements of clauses 2 or 3 of Irish Statutory IS 419.

The sample for flammability testing must include the filling as well as the cover, which corresponds to the production.

Note: *If there is foam in these products, it should also be tested to Schedule 1, in addition to the testing schedules marked in Table 4. Note: ** The tests must pass either the filling itself or the filling tested in the primary cover.

The density (kg/m³) of the test filling material must correspond to the actual density of the pillow and/or cushion.

Note: Density must be specified in the test report.

Test reports must be renewed once a year and must be sent to JYSK C&Q in accordance with JYSK General Requirements.

If there are changes in the supply chain, a new test report must still be provided.

Type 2 products must carry a permanent label in accordance with chapter 6.

Note: Display labels are not required for Product type 2.
source: JYSK 4002 - UK and Ireland Fire Regulation.pdf

content:
For foam pillows with a zipper in the main cover, the filling must have an inner cushion cover, with label according to chapter 6 product type 2. The same information must be stated on packaging.

Fillings must meet the flammability requirements of Schedule 1 or 2 of the UK regulations.

Fillings must meet the flammability requirements of clauses 2 or 3 of Irish Statutory IS 419.

Mattresses and mattress toppers must meet the domestic requirements of BS 7177 (low hazard) to comply with GPSR, thus pass the cigarette test as specified in EN 597-1 and match test as specified in EN 597-2.

To comply with BS 7177 testing must follow the frequency according to Table 5 unless any major changes has been made to the product in which case retesting is necessary.

| Number of units produced per month   | Number of units tested   |
|:-------------------------------------|:-------------------------|
| More than 2400                       | 1 per month              |
| Between 400 and 2400                 | 1 per 2400 units         |
| Less than 400                        | 1 every 6 months         |

Mattresses, top mattresses and mattress pads with filling must carry the BS 7177 label (low hazard) to show that they meet applicable requirements.

The label must be permanently attached to the product i.e. sewn in a seam and be clearly readable.

• Letter-height must be at least 10 points (~2,5 mm).

• The letters must be legible, in durable print, and appear on a label of sufficient color contrast to enable them to be seen clearly.

• The label must be durably and securely attached to the furniture, i.e. cannot be removed without causing damage

to the label or the product and must be able to withstand normal wear and tear of everyday use and misuse.

• The label must be securely attached to the external surface of the item, so that it is visible and legible to any person inspecting the article.

• It is permissible to attach the label to the underside of the item, e.g. under a chair.

• It is permissible to use a self-adhesive label if it meets all requirements.

Wording and order of the permanent label must be in accordance with Table 6.

• Texts must be adapted according to the tests conducted for the specific product.
